The most cost-effective way to access all our Research Reports is by subscribing to Creamer Media's Research Channel Africa - you can upgrade your subscription now at this [link](https://store.creamermedia.co.za/products/research-channel-africa-1-user-1). If you are a Creamer Media subscriber, click [here](javascript:void(0);) to log in. ASX-listed Lucapa Diamond Company has recovered a 203 ct type IIa diamond at its 40%-owned Lulo Alluvial operations, in Angola. The diamond is the fifth-largest diamond to be recovered from Lulo since mining started in 2015. Its recovery follows two other diamonds recovered in February, weighing 162 ct and 116 ct, respectively.
